International Restrictions:
*All travellers: All travellers should familiarise themselves with the entry rules for Pitcairn Island before travel.
*If you’re fully vaccinated: You must be fully vaccinated to enter Pitcairn, and provide proof of vaccination (such as your COVID Pass). At least 14 days must have passed since your second dose of the vaccine and the vaccine must be approved by the World Heath Organisation.
In addition to being fully vaccinated, there are other requirements regarding PCR and RAT testing prior to embarkation and landing. These requirements are different depending on how you travel to Pitcairn. Details are available on the Pitcairn Island Government website. *If you’re not fully vaccinated: If you’re not fully vaccinated, you will not be allowed entry to Pitcairn. Minors who do not qualify for vaccination are exempt from this prohibition.


Internal Restrictions:
*Travel in Pitcairn Island: There are only two metalled roads on Pitcairn. Other roads are dirt tracks. Transport around the island is by quad bike or on foot. All quad bikes are privately owned and therefore most visitors travel on foot. Longer-term visitors who propose using a quad bike need to pass a short quad bike driving test before a licence will be issued by the island Police Officer.
*Accommodation: There are no hotels but self-catering and homestay accommodation with local families is available.
